ca.mcgill.ecse211.ARR

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.ARR.Navigation

  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles all movement of the robot, where motor initialization is private. Other classes statically call the methods to move.

           throws OdometerExceptions
        Class constructor
        Parameters:
        leftLight - : takes in SampleProvider for left light sensor

        odo - : takes in odometer, instead of calling Odometer to get, this ensures odometer instantiated first
        Throws:

    • Method Detail

      • travelStartToTunnel

        public static void travelStartToTunnel()
                                throws OdometerExceptions
        Method asssumes robot done localizing, takes coordinates and calculates the trajectory to the tunnel based on four cases. If the tunnel is placed vertically, it travels first horizontally (along the x axis) then vertically (along y axis) so that it may re-localize just before entering the tunnel, the robot will be accurately within one tile of the tunnel to travel without a hitch. It takes the robot to and through the tunnel. Cases: 1) tunnel has vertical orientation and its midpoint x value is within 1 tile of robot x value 2) tunnel has vertical orientation and its midpoint x value is greater than 1 tile of robot x value 3) tunnel has horizontal orientation and its midpoint y value is within 1 tile of robot y value 4) tunnel has horizontal orientation and its midpoint y value is greater than 1 tile of robot y value In order to achieve localization before entering tunnel for cases 1 and 3, we must move away from the tunnel midpoint so as to be able to turn to it and catch the second line.
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions

      • travelTunnelToRingSet

        public static void travelTunnelToRingSet()
                                  throws OdometerExceptions
        This method takes the robot from just having gone outside the tunnel to the ring set so that it is in position to start circling the set detecting the ring colors. There are two cases of traversing. Since the robot ends in middle of tunnel tile and ring sets are placed on intersections, the set will either be to the left or right of tunnel. If to the left we move to the closest tile (bottom right of four surrounding tiles relative to the robot heading and placement of ring set), if to the right we move to bottom right of four surrounding tiles. It then aligns the robot to start traversing the ring set in a clockwise direction.
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions

      • detectRings

        public static void detectRings()

      • getClosestTiles

        public static double[] getClosestTiles(boolean ringSetIsLeft)
        This method takes in the side the ring set is on relative to the heading of the robot upon exiting the tunnel. Calculates the center coordinates of the tiles closest to the robot in order to traverse properly to a position where it can begin to search and retrieve.
        Parameters:
        ringSetIsLeft - : whether the ring set is to the left or right of the robot
        Returns:
        : a double[] of 4 values where the first two are for the first closest tile coordinates and the second two values are second closest.

      • isRingSetToLeft

        public static boolean isRingSetToLeft()
        This method uses the game parameters and the robots current heading to calculate whether the ring set is to the left or right of the robot upon exiting the tunnel
        Returns:
        : true if ring set is to the left of the robot, false if to the right

      • getCurrentHeading

        public static java.lang.String getCurrentHeading()
        This method gets the current theta heading from the odometer and returns the heading of the robot as a string.
        Returns:
        : returns a String with either "north", "south", "east", "west"

      • travelToWithCorrection

        public static void travelToWithCorrection(double x,
                                          double y)
                                   throws OdometerExceptions
        This method makes the robot move in the direction of the waypoint whose coordinates are passed as arguments. The robot moves until a perpendicular line is crossed where the first sensor to cross the line that motor will stop while the other wheel moves until that side's sensor picks up the same line, correcting the robots heading. The method expects the robot to initially be traveling horizontally or vertically. Assumption: the two front light sensors must be polling
        Parameters:
        x - : x coordinate
        y - : y coordinate
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions

      • correctOdometer

        public static void correctOdometer()
                            throws OdometerExceptions
        This method is used when the robot is traveling either horizontally or vertically and its light sensors have stopped on top of the lines. It retrieved the direction and location of robot and corrects odometer values. If traveling x then only corrects x, always corrects theta. Estimates heading and position based on odometer readings so assumes readings are not off by a certain amount.
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions

      • findTunnelHeading

        public static void findTunnelHeading()
        This method finds out if the tunnel is vertical or horizontal by observing the absolute difference between the tunnels lower left and upper right x values and sets the class variable isTunnelVertical accordingly.

      • isTunnelWithinOneTile

        public static boolean isTunnelWithinOneTile(double tunnelValue,
                                            double robotValue)
        This method is passed in either x values or y values (only) of both the tunnel and robot values; must pass in either both x values or both y values. Checks to see if the absolute distance is within one tile.
        Parameters:
        tunnelValue - : x or y value of tunnel midpoint
        robotValue - : x or y value of robot current position
        Returns:
        : true if within one tile

      • findTunnelMidpoint

        public static double[] findTunnelMidpoint(boolean start)
        This method finds and returns the midpoint of the start or end of the robot's team's tunnel. Assumes the tunnel coordinates given i.e. BRR_LL and BRR_UR for red team, are not in actual distance values but coordinate values.
        Parameters:
        start - : boolean check, if true then method returns exit midpoint of tunnel relative to robot start and team
        Returns:
        midpoint: double[] coordinates of tunnel midpoint in actual distance measurement

      • travelTo

        public static void travelTo(double x,
                            double y)
        This method causes the robot to travel to the absolute field location (x, y),specified in tile points.
        Parameters:
        x: - x coordinate
        y: - y coordinate

      • turnTo

        public static void turnTo(double theta)
        This method causes the robot to turn (on point) to the absolute heading theta. This method should turn a MINIMAL angle to its target.
        Parameters:
        theta - : theta angle

      • turnToCoord

        public static void turnToCoord(double x,
                               double y)
        This method takes two coordinates and turns the robot to face those coordinates based on where the robot currently is.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -

      • moveStraight

        public static void moveStraight(double distance,
                                boolean forwards,
                                boolean continueRunning)
        Parameters:
        distance: - distance to travel
        forwards: - if true then it goes forward direction
        continueRunning: - if true then program does not wait for wheels to stop, false program waits

      • turnRobot

        public static void turnRobot(int degrees,
                             boolean direction,
                             boolean continueRunning)
        This method turns the robot to the right or left depending on direction boolean and turns the robot by the specified degrees amount.
        Parameters:
        degrees: - degrees to turn by
        direction: - true means turn right, left otherwise

      • stopMotors

        public void stopMotors()
        This methods stops both of the motors and returns immediately

        This method sets the speed and acceleration of the robot
        Parameters:
        speed - The speed to set both the motors
        acceleration - The acceleration to set both motors

        Returns:
        : rotations in degrees

      • isNavigating

        public boolean isNavigating()
        Returns:
        true if another thread has called travelTo() or turnTo() and the method has yet to return; false otherwise.
